title: Landuse totals

variables.long_name: all of the rainfed cropland
all of the irrigated cropland
share of the total cropland
share of managed pastures or rangeland

comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information on the land use data refer to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/82/>.

title: Downscaling to 5 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated C3 annual crops
share of rainfed C3 annual crops
share of irrigated C3 perennial crops
share of rainfed C3 perennial crops
share of irrigated C3 N-fixing crops
share of rainfed C3 N-fixing crops
share of irrigated C4 annual crops
share of rainfed C4 annual crops
share of irrigated C4 perennial crops
share of rainfed C4 perennial crops

comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

title: Downscaling to 15 crops

variables.long_name: share of irrigated others perennial
share of rainfed others perennial
share of irrigated Sugarcane
share of rainfed Sugarcane
share of irrigated Maize
share of rainfed Maize
share of irrigated Oil crops groundnut
share of rainfed Oil crops groundnut
share of irrigated Oil crops rapeseed
share of rainfed Oil crops rapeseed
share of irrigated
share of rainfed
share of irrigated
share of rainfed
share of irrigated
share of rainfed
share of irrigated
share of rainfed
managed grassland
share of irrigated Pulses
share of rainfed Pulses
share of irrigated Rice
share of rainfed Rice
share of irrigated Temperate cereals
share of rainfed Temperate cereals
share of irrigated Temperate roots
share of rainfed Temperate roots
share of irrigated Tropical cereals
share of rainfed Tropical cereals
share of irrigated Tropical roots
share of rainfed Tropical roots

comment: The C4 perennial crops are not further downscaled from the "5 crops" data set and currently only include sugarcane.  Similarly, the C3 perennial crops are not downscaled either. The data is derived from the "5 crops" LUH2 data, and the crops have been downscaled to 15 crops according to the ratios given by the Monfreda data set ([Monfreda, Ramankutty, and Foley, 2008](https://doi.org/10.1029/2007GB002947)).

title: Managed pastures and rangeland

variables.long_name: share of managed pastures
share of rangeland

comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

title: Urban areas

variables.long_name: share of urban areas

comment: Based on the HYDE 3.2 data set ([Klein Goldewijk, 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-9-927-2017)), but harmonized by Hurtt et al. (LUH2 v2h data set, see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>).

title: Nitrogen deposited by fertilizers on croplands

variables.long_name: N input through fertilizer on cropland with C3 annual crops
C3 N-fixing crops
C3 perennial crops
C4 annual crops
C4 perennial crops

comment: Based on the LUH2 v2h data set (see [Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/28/>.

variables.long_name: NHx deposition (nhx)

comment.ISIMIP3a: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.
comment.ISIMIP3b: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) ([SPARC newsletter n° 40](https://www.geo.fu-berlin.de/met/ag/strat/publikationen/docs/Eyring-et-al_SPARC-Newsletter40.pdf)). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

variables.long_name: NOy deposition (noy)

comment.ISIMIP3a: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) during 1850-2014 ([Tian et al., 2018](https://doi.org/10.1175/BAMS-D-17-0212.1)). Data for 2015-2021 is assumed to be same as that in 2014. Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.
comment.ISIMIP3b: Simulated by NCAR Chemistry-Climate Model Initiative (CCMI) ([SPARC newsletter n° 40](https://www.geo.fu-berlin.de/met/ag/strat/publikationen/docs/Eyring-et-al_SPARC-Newsletter40.pdf)). Nitrogen deposition data was interpolated to 0.5° by 0.5° by the nearest grid. For further information refer also to <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-correction/details/24/>.

title: GGCMI crop calendar for Phase 3

variables.long_name: Planting day, separated for rainfed and irrigated crops where applicable
Maturity day, separated for rainfed and irrigated crops where applicable
Growing season length
Data source used

comment: Reference: [Jägermeyr et al. 2021](https://doi.org/10.1038/s43016-021-00400-y). Data: [Jägermeyr et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5062513). So far, only a crop calendar, which is static in time is available. It is labeled as 2015soc, but can also be used for histsoc simulations, e.g. in combination with time-varying fertilizer inputs.

title: Reservoirs & dams

variables.long_name: Unique ID representing a dam and its associated reservoir corresponding to GRanD/KSU IDs
Name of dam structure
Original longitudinal location of the dam
variables.specifier: Original latitudinal location of the dam

variables.long_name: original location
Longitude, adjusted to the DDM30 0.5° grid cell centers
Latitude, adjusted to 0.5° grid cell centers
Upstream area draining into the reservoir using DDM30
Upstream area draining into the reservoir acc. to GRanD
Representative maximum storage capacity of reservoir [10⁶ m³]
Year of construction, completion, commissioning, etc.
Flag to indicate that the year of dam construction has been artificially set to 1850 if not existing
Altern. year: may indicate multi-year construction, secondary dam, etc.
Flag of correction if relocation was applied
Name of the river which the dam impounds
Country where the dam is located
Height of the dam. If multiple  heights are available, the foundation height was used.
Maximum inundation area of the reservoir
Main purpose(s) of the dam
Sources used to collect this dam’s information
Other notes

comment: [Lehner et al. (2011a)](https://doi.org/10.7927/H4N877QK), [Lehner et al. (2011b)](https://dx.doi.org/10.1890/100125), and Jida Wang et al. (KSU/Kansas State University, personal communication, data starting in 2016). Because the data from KSU is yet unpublished, modeling teams using it are asked to offer co-authorship to the team at KSU on any resulting publications. Please contact <info@isimip.org> in case of questions.

title: Water abstraction for domestic and industrial purposes

variables.long_name: domestic water withdrawal
domestic water consumption
industrial water withdrawal
industrial water consumption

comment: For modelling groups that do not have their own representation, we provide files containing the multi-model mean of domestic and industrial water withdrawal and consumption generated by WaterGAP, PCR-GLOBWB, and H08. This data is based ISIMIP2a varsoc simulations for 1901-2005, and on RCP6.0 simulations from the Water Futures and Solutions project ([Wada et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-9-175-2016)) for after 2005. Years before 1901 have been filled with the value for year 1901.

title: Fishing effort

variables.long_name: The generic name of the FAO area in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The EEZ / high seas name in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The generic name of the Large Marine ecosystem in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
Functional Group of the target species
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the reported catch
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the illegal catch and discards
Year (end of the year) when the Effort/Catch is occurring
Water surface area
Number of 0.5 degree cell making up the area
Fishing country, in ISO3 notation. Ex supranational entities (USSR, Yugoslavia) are disaggregated to their constituent countries. Serbian Fishing Effort included with Montenegro
Fishing sector (artisanal/industrial), defined by the law of the country (varies by country)
A number code to the LME, as per NOAA notation
A number code to the FAO area

resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
comment: Data comprise the nominal effort of industrial and artisanal fleets aggregated into 6 functional groups. Source: [Rousseau et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.1820344116).

title: Fish catch

variables.long_name: The generic name of the FAO area in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The EEZ / high seas name in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
The generic name of the Large Marine ecosystem in which the Effort/Catch is occurring
Functional Group of the target species
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the reported catch
Nominal (i.e. not including the technological creep) fishing effort corresponding to the illegal catch and discards
Year (end of the year) when the Effort/Catch is occurring
Water surface area
Number of 0.5 degree cell making up the area
Fishing country, in ISO3 notation. Ex supranational entities (USSR, Yugoslavia) are disaggregated to their constituent countries. Serbian Fishing Effort included with Montenegro
Fishing sector (artisanal/industrial), defined by the law of the country (varies by country)
A number code to the LME, as per NOAA notation
A number code to the FAO area

resolution: Marine ecosystems or exclusive economic zones
comment: Data comprise the nominal effort of industrial and artisanal fleets aggregated into 6 functional groups. Reference for data source: [Watson and Tidd (2018)](https://doi.org/10.1016/j.marpol.2018.04.023).

title: Forest management

variables.long_name: stem numbers
tree species

comment: [Reyer et al. (2019)](https://doi.org/10.5880/PIK.2019.008), and [Reyer et al. (2020)](https://doi.org/10.5194/essd-12-1295-2020) management prescribes stem numbers remaining after harvest, management data is annual but not every year has data.

title: Wood harvesting

variables.long_name: wood harvest area from primary forest land
wood harvest area from primary non forest land
wood harvest area from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest area from secondary young forest land
wood harvest area from secondary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from primary non forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary mature forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary young forest land
wood harvest biomass carbon from secondary non forest land

comment: Historic annual country-level wood harvesting data. Based on the LUH2 v2h Harmonization Data Set ([Hurtt, Chini, Sahajpal, Frolking, et al., 2020](https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-13-5425-2020), see also <https://luh.umd.edu>). Interpolated to a 0.5° grid using first-order conservative remapping and calculated over a fractional country mask (<https://gitlab.pik-potsdam.de/isipedia/countrymasks/-/blob/master/>) derived from [ASAP-GAUL](https://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/dataset/jrc-10112-10004). For further information see <https://www.isimip.org/gettingstarted/input-data-bias-adjustment/details/83/>

title: Lake area fraction

variables.long_name: Lake and reservoir percent

comment: Lake and reservoir area fraction/percentage calculated from the Hydrolakes v1.0 June 2019 ([Messager et al., 2016](https://doi.org/10.1038/ncomms13603)) and GRanDv1.3 databases ([Lehner et al., 2011](https://doi.org/10.1890/100125)) mapped to 0.5 degrees resolution, time steps represent increasing reservoirs in their construction year, as given by GRanDv1.3 Reservoirs from 2017 onwards are kept constant. More information about the calculation can be found at <https://github.com/icra/ISIMIP_Lake_Sector>.

title: Population (gridded)

variables.long_name: total population
urban population
rural population

comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

title: Population (country-level)

variables.long_name: total number of people per country

comment: Historical population data are based on the 2019 Revision of the United Nations World Population Prospects ([United Nations, 2019](https://population.un.org/wpp/)). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).

title: GDP

variables.long_name: Gross domestic product

comment: Historic country-level GDP data are based on GDP per capita estimates from the WDI (1965-2020). For countries not covered by the UNWPP we use data from various sources (e.g. CIA World Factbook, Insee, BEA, PRISM, and Woldometers) compiled in a MissingIslands dataset ([Arujo et al., 2021](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4421504)).
